intro: Acrostichum herminieri, commonly known as the golden hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and has broad, heart-shaped leaves. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates.
